question: Does Curare function by stimulating the acetylcholine receptor?
ideal_answer: No. Curare function does not stimulate the acetylcholine receptor.

snippets.text: Usual clinical concentrations of curare cause competitive inhibition of muscle nicotinic acetylcholine receptors while higher concentrations may induce open channel blockade.
